text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello am utso a cloud engineer at the
AWS office in Cape Town today I will
show you how to turn on automatic
encryption for new Amazon elastic block
storage volumes and snapshot copies
created in your AWS account let's get
started first log to the AWS Management
console and then navigate to the Amazon
E2
console select the AWS region where you
want to turn on default encryption once
you are in ec2 dashboard under account
attributes select data protection and
security choose manage in the subsection
EBS encryption on the modify EBS
encryption page under always encrypt new
EBS volume choose
enable next choose default encryption
key here you can select any of your AWS
Key Management Service keys to set as
the default key when you encrypt new
volumes and snapshot after you select
the key choose update EBS
encryption that's it you have now turned
on default encryption for all new EBS
volumes and snapshot copies in this AWS
region repeat the same steps for any
other the regions where you want default
encryption turned on so now you know how
to turn on automatic encryption for new
Amazon EBS volumes and snapshot copies
created in your AWS
account thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
ews
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
